data.long_description_html:
If you've been working in software these last few years, chances are you've noticed increased concern around software vulnerabilities. In the wake of major software supply chain attacks, governments and organizations have been taking significant action to improve cybersecurity practices, with vulnerability management serving as a key pillar. But what exactly is vulnerability management, how does one practice it, and is it really something you need to worry about?

In this course, you will learn the tools and fundamentals of vulnerability management and why it's critical that every developer understand it. You will also learn about the significant challenges involved and how to use Chainguard Containers to drastically reduce the toil. In addition to this practical knowledge, you will gain an appreciation of the evolving, controversial, and high-stakes landscape of vulnerability management. It’s a fascinating world full of philosophical questions, geopolitical plot points, shadowy villains, spicy takes, and — if we have any say in it — a good deal of technical fun. ðŸ¤“ In other words, software supply chain security is a work in progress that needs your help and participation. So pack your containers, get ready for memes, and let's forge the path to a secure-by-default digital future.

When you finish this course, you will receive a badge that you can add to your LinkedIn page.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev. 

Who is this course for?
This course is designed for developers and software professionals who want to learn about emerging regulations around vulnerability management and state-of-the-art tools and practices in this space. Participants will also learn how to use Chainguard Images to painlessly reduce vulnerabilities in their workloads.  
Certificate of Completion
Participants who pass the quizzes at the end of each module and finish the short final project will earn a Certificate of Completion. 
Prerequisites

No technical skills are needed for the conceptual articles, which comprise about 75% of the course. For the technical tutorials, you should have experience with running containers and will need Docker, crane, and jq installed on your machine. 
Time to complete
Three to five hours. 
Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • 3-5h

  • 18 Lessons

data.long_description_html:
As AI/ML adoption grows, so do the risks. From poisoned datasets to compromised models, the AI/ML software supply chain is full of potential vulnerabilities. Governments and industry leaders are acting fast, but what does securing the AI/ML supply chain actually look like in practice? This course unpacks the threats, tools, and standards shaping Machine Learning Security Operations (MLSecOps) today.

This course teaches the fundamentals of software supply chain security for AI/ML systems, a significant component of MLSecOps. It is designed for anyone who wants to understand the why and how of securing the AI/ML supply chain, including data scientists, machine learning engineers, AI researchers, and other software or security professionals who encounter these technologies on the job.

Participants will practice hands-on exercises on tools and methods for safeguarding AI/ML systems throughout their lifecycle, and ensuring the transparency, authenticity, and integrity of the software components used in AI/ML development. They will also learn key supply chain security topics, such as the threat landscape of AI/ML systems, attack surfaces in the AI/ML development lifecycle, and standards, regulations, and governing bodies that are actively shaping cybersecurity practices in this domain.

Participants who complete the course will earn a Credly badge, and have the skills to start securing AI/ML supply chains in their organization.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev.

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • 3-5h

  • 18 Lessons

This course unpacks the threats, tools, and standards shaping MLSecOps today.

data.long_description_html:
Software Supply Chain Security is an increasingly hot topic, and for good reasons. Software supply chain attacks are on the rise, leaking confidential data, enabling ransomware, and putting the critical infrastructure of high-stakes organizations such as healthcare, transportation, finance, government, and energy at risk. Juniper Research estimates that these attacks will cost the global economy more than $80 billion in lost revenue by 2026. Unfortunately, they may also threaten our safety and stability, and at the very least, make the lives of developers everywhere miserable. 

Fortunately, there are a number of tools and methods that are invaluable to enhancing software supply chain security. However, to understand the logic behind these tools and methods, it’s useful to develop a solid foundation in the principles that underpin them. In this course, you will learn about key software supply chain security concepts, such as vulnerability scanning, digital signing, Software Bills of Materials (SBOMs), and provenance to help provide contextual information around security practices. 

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • 1-2h

  • 7 Lessons
data.short_description: Learn about key concepts in supply chain security including vulnerabilities, SBOMs, scanning, code signing, and provenance.
data.title: Foundations of Software Supply Chain Security

data.long_description_html:
This course teaches key skills for getting started with Chainguard Containers, focusing on Container acquisition, management, and security. Participants will learn how to effectively set up identity authentication, scan Containers for vulnerabilities, verify Containers integrity, and update Containers in a secure and efficient manner. The course also includes a user interface (UI) walkthrough to help users navigate and utilize Chainguard's tools. After taking this course, participants will have the necessary skills for implementing Chainguard Containers in their organization. 

Learning objectives:

  • Gain an overview of Chainguard Containers, including how to get started and manage these container images within your environment.
  • Learn how to configure identity authentication to secure access to Containers.
  • Master the process of scanning Containers for security vulnerabilities and verifying their authenticity.
  • Discover best practices for keeping your Containers up to date.
  • Familiarize yourself with the Chainguard UI through a detailed video walkthrough, enhancing your ability to utilize the platform effectively.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev. 

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • <2h

  • 8 Lessons
data.short_description: Learn everything you need to know to set up, run, and manage Chainguard Containers to secure your software supply chain.
data.title: Getting Started With Chainguard Containers

data.long_description_html:
In this course, you will learn how to manage user access to the Chainguard Registry, configure custom identity providers, ingest container images into an internal registry, and utilize Chainguard Events for various use cases.

Learning objectives:

  • Managing User Access: Learn how to add and offboard users from a Chainguard Registry using chainctl and Chainguard Console, and understand the role-binding process.
  • Configuring Custom Identity Providers: Find out how to set up and administer Single Sign-on (SSO) authentication with custom OIDC-compatible identity providers, and understand the setup process for identity providers such as Okta and Ping Identity.
  • Ingesting Containers Into an Internal Registry: Explore how to implement scheduled image copies, set up pull-through caches, and configure remote repositories for pulling Chainguard Containers using Artifactory as an example.
  • Utilizing Chainguard Events: Gain an understanding Chainguard Events, and actions you can apply to them.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev.

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • <1h

  • 4 Lessons
data.short_description: Learn how to administer the Chainguard Registry with style.
data.title: Registry Rockstar

data.long_description_html:
This course provides an in-depth understanding of CVEs (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures), their impact on software security, and how to navigate Chainguard's CVE tools and resources.

Learning objectives

  • Gain a comprehensive understanding of software vulnerabilities, how they are reported, their risks, and related resources for interpreting their impact. 
  • Learn how to scan container images for CVEs in development, production, and when evaluating images for use.
  • Explore using chainctl to compare different versions of Chainguard Containers and find out which vulnerabilities have been patched. 
  • Find out why vulnerabilities occasionally surface in Chainguard Containers and what to do when you find one.  
  • Discover how to navigate and use Chainguard's Security Advisories page to search for vulnerabilities and check advisory statuses.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev. 

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • <1h

  • 5 Lessons
data.short_description: Learn everything you need to know to kick software vulnerabilities to the curb.
data.title: Crush Your CVEs

data.long_description_html:
Superstar Support is your shortcut to Chainguard confidence. Requesting new images, troubleshooting those mystery CVEs, wrangling Console permissions, or just exploring the Support Portal? We’ll show you how to get answers fast. You’ll learn when to self-serve, when to submit a ticket, and some power user tips. By the end, you’ll know how to get help, solve problems faster, and even level up the whole Chainguard community with your feedback and tips. No rabbit holes, no panic, and maybe a meme or two along the way.

Learning objectives:

At the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

  • Access and use Chainguard Academy and the Support Portal to find documentation, submit support requests, and manage tickets.
  • Understand the process for making image, package, or feature requests, including the key details the support team needs for fast responses.
  • Interpret vulnerability scan results using Chainguard’s Security Advisories, and know what to do next when CVEs are found in your images.
  • Navigate the Chainguard Console and Support Portal to manage users, permissions, and team onboarding.
  • Troubleshoot common issues independently using AI, documentation, and status pages.
  • Share feedback, request demos or training (via your account team), and contribute feedback to help the whole Chainguard community.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev.

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • <1h

  • 5 Lessons
data.short_description: Skip the stress and get answers fast. Youâ€™ll learn how to navigate Chainguardâ€™s support like a superstar and keep your supply chain secure with zero ticket anxiety.
data.title: Chainguard's Superstar Support

data.long_description_html:
This course is designed to make you a Chainguard Container expert. You'll learn about the significance of different versions, how FIPS images work, and a variety of actions you can take such as retrieving a container image's SBOM, comparing different image versions, and using the chainctl command line tool.

Learning objectives

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

  • Identify and explain the key differences between development and production container images, and understand the security implications of using each variant.
  • Retrieve a Chainguard Container's SBOM using the cosign command and understand the information provided in the SBOM, including license details and source code references.
  • Use the Tag History API to compare different builds of Chainguard Containers and understand how to identify differences, such as added or removed vulnerabilities, between container image versions.
  • Understand FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) and how to use FIPS-enabled versions of Chainguard Images to meet compliance requirements, including the use of FIPS-validated cryptography.
  • Use the chainctl command line interface tool to compare two Chainguard Containers, identify added or removed vulnerabilities, and make informed decisions about container image updates and deployments.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev.

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • <2h

  • 9 Lessons
data.short_description: Go deep with your Chainguard Containers skills!
data.title: Containers! Containers! Containers!

long_description_html:

You'll learn about the significance of different versions, how FIPS images work, and a variety of actions you can take such as retrieving a container image's SBOM, comparing different image versions, and using the chainctl command line tool.

Learning objectives

At the end of this course, students will be able to:

  • Identify and explain the key differences between development and production container images, and understand the security implications of using each variant.
  • Retrieve a Chainguard Container's SBOM using the cosign command and understand the information provided in the SBOM, including license details and source code references.
  • Use the Tag History API to compare different builds of Chainguard Containers and understand how to identify differences, such as added or removed vulnerabilities, between container image versions.
  • Understand FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standards) and how to use FIPS-enabled versions of Chainguard Images to meet compliance requirements, including the use of FIPS-validated cryptography.
  • Use the chainctl command line interface tool to compare two Chainguard Containers, identify added or removed vulnerabilities, and make informed decisions about container image updates and deployments.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev.

  • 9 Lessons
short_description: Go deep with your Chainguard Containers skills!
title: Containers! Containers! Containers!

data.long_description_html:
This short course will provide guidance for migrating to Chainguard Containers, including an overview of the features and differences of Chainguard Containers, how to handle missing dependencies, and how to test for breakage. 

Learning objectives

  • Learn about the features of Chainguard Containers, including their security, freshness, minimal design, full cycle support, and transparency.
  • Explore methods for finding, adding, and managing dependencies in Chainguard Containers, as well as understanding the use of -dev variants and multi-stage builds.
  • Gain knowledge of testing strategies for Chainguard Containers, including manual testing, testing specific components, and methods for debugging distroless container images.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev. 

Course Details

  • Developers; Software Professionals

  • <1h

  • 3 Lessons
data.short_description: Yee haw! How to move over to the safest container images in town!
data.title: Migration Guidance

long_description_html:

  • Explore methods for finding, adding, and managing dependencies in Chainguard Containers, as well as understanding the use of -dev variants and multi-stage builds.
  • Gain knowledge of testing strategies for Chainguard Containers, including manual testing, testing specific components, and methods for debugging distroless container images.

short_description: Yee haw! How to move over to the safest container images in town!

data.long_description_html:
This course teaches the fundamental aspects of building Chainguard Containers. The first four articles provide a conceptual overview of Chainguard Containers and packages. The remaining five articles provide hands-on guidance for building, testing, and submitting container images and packages. By the end of this course, you will have built your first (simple) image.

Learning objectives

  • Understand what Chainguard Containers are
  • Grasp how Chainguard Containers are used
  • Learn what goes into a Chainguard Container
  • Distinguish between Chainguard’s public and private container images
  • Set up your development environment
  • Find existing APK packages and create new ones
  • Submit packages you build
  • Make a Chainguard Container
  • Test and verify Chainguard Containers
  • Submit container images you build

If you have any questions or feedback about the course, feel free to reach out to the Dev Enablement team in the #docs slack channel.

Course Details

  • Chainguard Superstars

  • 2h, excluding dev tool set up

  • 9 Lessons
data.short_description: This course is designed to teach new Chainguard engineers how to build container images.
data.title: Build Your First Chainguard Container

Learning objectives

Want to dive into Chainguard Containers as quickly as possible? We got you! In this condensed course on Chainguard Containers, you'll get a quick overview of everything you need to know to get started ASAP.

This course includes our full series of customer onboarding courses. You can also browse individual courses, such as Getting Started With Chainguard Containers, Containers! Containers! Containers! (or Advanced Container Usage), Registry Overview, Foundations of Software Supply Chain Security, Crush Your CVEs, Migration Guidance.

If you have any questions or comments, feel free to reach out at courses@chainguard.dev.

  • <1h

  • 6 Lessons

data.title: Getting Started with Chainguard's Custom Assembly

long_description_html: This short course helps Chainguard customers understand what Custom Assembly is, why it matters, and how to use it to create more secure, tailored container images. Ideal for new users who want to skip complex build steps and maintain image integrity.
